p: The “Hulu-Langat” was the most representative variant in Sicily (85.0%; n = 51/60). It firstly characterized an outbreak of measles that began in the westernmost part of Sicily in April 2016 and then progressively spread to the Central and Eastern part of the region. Afterwards, the D8 genotype was very rarely identified in our area and the molecular layout of circulating MVs substantially switched to the B3 genotype ( Fig 3).
